comment: Why halogens in compounds can have only one negative oxidation degree -1?

Flourine cannot have an oxidation state of + 1 because that would mean oxygen has a state of negative two, which would imply that oxygen is better at taking electrons and﻿ therefore more electronegative than flourine. But we know that this is not true because flourine is the most electronegative atom on the periodic table. Therefore, the correct oxidation numbers of HOF are +1,0,-1. Cheers
Flourine has an oxidation state of +1 in HOF(Hypoflourous acid)
